info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 1:44AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River at Columbus, Seymour, Williams, Bedford, Rivervale, and Shoals.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Big Blue River at Shelbyville.
.Widespread and significant flooding is in progress. Rainfall amounts of four to over six inches have fallen over the past several days.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, Major flood is in progress. Many evacuations from residential areas in flood plain are necessary. Portions of nearly 60 county and private roads are impassable, many by several feet of water. Many local river residents must park on high ground and boat out. Extensive damage occurs to local roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 AM EDT Sunday was 24.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 36.3 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 445 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
